column4: Hello, i have a problem --> I cannot mount the diskettes on Hoary
some idea of what it can be?
you mean 3.5 inch or 5.25 inch diskettes? what error do you get when mounting?
3.5 --> Unable to mount the selected volume.
--> mount: I could not determine the filesystem type, and none was specified
I have 90 machines with Hoary and everything presents the problem
hrm. are you sure the disk is ok?
completely, they are new discs, I have proven more than 20 discs
have they been formatted yet?
yes, the majority has been formatted in GuiDOuS , is a College ...
many of the users still use that system (Win)
Window$
before we had Debian Sarge and FC-2 and worked without problems discs
try 'sudo mount -t vfat /dev/fd0 /media/floppy0'  (assuming that /media/floppy0 exists)
of that way if he works, but the users are not very capable for the handling of the terminal,
hrm, sorry. i don't use diskettes, i don't know what the problem is
I need that the users can mount discs through the graphical surroundings
you can take a look at the 'mtools' package - it provides dos-like copy/directory listing commands
sorry, i don't have a solution for that
ok. thx ... where I can report that error?
you can try bugzilla.ubuntu.com
